title: skl2onnx over specifies dependencies
body:
skl2onnx specifies dependencies to a greater degree than needed which can lead to some tools having dependency resolution problems.

`requirements.txt` currently specifies:

```
numpy>=1.15
scipy>=1.0
protobuf
onnx>=1.2.1
scikit-learn>=0.19, <1.2
onnxconverter-common>=1.7.0
```

But eg. `scikit-learn` requires version constrained `numpy`, `scipy`, and `onnxconverter-common` already requires `protobuf` (any version) etc. Here's the full dependency graph of skl2onnx from `poetry`:

```bash
skl2onnx 1.13 Convert scikit-learn models to ONNX
├── numpy >=1.15
├── onnx >=1.2.1
│   ├── numpy >=1.16.6
│   ├── protobuf >=3.12.2
│   └── typing-extensions >=3.6.2.1
├── onnxconverter-common >=1.7.0
│   ├── numpy *
│   ├── onnx *
│   │   ├── numpy >=1.16.6 (circular dependency aborted here)
│   │   ├── protobuf >=3.12.2
│   │   └── typing-extensions >=3.6.2.1
│   ├── packaging *
│   │   └── pyparsing >=2.0.2,<3.0.5 || >3.0.5
│   └── protobuf * (circular dependency aborted here)
├── protobuf *
├── scikit-learn >=0.19,<=1.1.1
│   ├── joblib >=1.0.0
│   ├── numpy >=1.17.3
│   ├── scipy >=1.3.2
│   │   └── numpy >=1.18.5,<1.26.0 (circular dependency aborted here)
│   └── threadpoolctl >=2.0.0
└── scipy >=1.0
    └── numpy >=1.18.5,<1.26.0

```

The `requirements.txt` can probably be reduced to:

```
onnx>=1.2.1
onnxconverter-common>=1.7.0
scikit-learn >=0.19,<=1.1.1
```
